reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights at the Bel Soggiorno, we chose this hotel as previous guests said it was a 10 minute uphill walk to the town, essential we feel if you want to take advantage of all that lovely pasta and pizza, and indeed I think you need to be fairly fit to get the best out of coastal towns like Taormina, Positano etc. Our room (No.9) was large and had it's own balcony with a good unrestricted view of the bay and Etna. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly, there was a new guy just started, and I did have to ask someone more senior before I got an iron on one occassion, and some ice on another (that was my only complaint regarding our room - there was no mini fridge). The breakfast was great, you don't feel rushed to finish, and indeed with such a fantastic view from the breakfast terrace it's tempting to linger a fair while.
reviews.title: Relaxed hotel with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Bel Soggiorno in Taormina during the first 3 days of our holiday trip around Sicily. The hotel is on a hill on the way to the city centre. It is just a 10 minutes walk via some stairs up the road. No problem for us. The room was very nice and clean, with a small balcony and a wonderfull seaview. The shower was the only thing that could have been better. Breakfast is very good and we good have it outside on the terrace, delicious cappucino and very friendly staff! Taormin itself is a wonderfull place, great food and wines, not that expensive compared to the prices in the Netherlands. A bottle of wine for 15 euros, Sicily has got some great wines, try the Altavilla della corte. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, love to come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a hotel in the grand old style of early 20th Century resorts. Our room had french doors that opened onto a semi-private area with lounge chairs overlooking the sea. Set on the edge of the hills that lead from the ocean up to the town of Taormina, practically every room of the hotel overlooks the sea, including the breakfast solarium. We stayed here for two nights, including New Year's Eve. We ended up being very happy that we were just a short walk outside of town, rather than in one of the many hotels in the center of town, which I imagine must be fairly loud. The staff at Bel Soggiorno were very friendly and helpful in making recommendations for driving to areas outside of Taormina proper (including up to Etna).

reviews.text: The Hotel Bel Soggiorno provided one of the highlights of our four weeks in Sicily: a friendly, welcoming, English speaking reception, a gorgeous buffet breakfast, fantastic views and a lovely location. Bel Soggiorno is on the approach road to Taormina (from the beaches below) and situated just behind a bus stop. We had a car and parked either in the driveway or just above. I have a walking handicap (and am "older") and although the steepish drive was a bit tricky, it was well worth the effort to stay in this "grand old hotel". Our room was a triple: our adult daughter had her own loft above our room with bed, sofa and writing desk-very spacious. Our accomodations included writing desk, wardrobe, nighttables and lamps, TV, air conditioning, and a well done, immaculate bathroom. Outside our french doors a terrace with table and chairs/sun bed and umbrella for our leisure use--all this overlooking the magnificent sea below! Nearby the huge dining room/bar and salon provided quiet corners where we could use the internet, write post cards, or just enjoy a drink and curl up with a book. The breakfast buffet was laid out along one wall (I vote this Sicily's best breakfast!) but all the guests found their way to the conservatory or the terrace to enjoy their meal.

Excellent for honeymoon
reviews.text: We had some of the best pasta we’ve ever eaten at al Giardiano & the staff were wonderful - it's opposite the gardens on the walk into the town.

It might not be the most lavish of hotels in the area, and doesn't offer any swimmingpool, but it's one of the most charming hotels I've ever stayed at. The service was really kind, warm, smiling and helpful. The real secret of this hotel though is the VIEW - it's got a spectacular view over the Mediterranean right from your room. There's also plenty of patio-space so you can have breakfast or dinner while enjoying that view. If you are as lucky as we were (corner room), you also get a view right at Edna. Nothing like waking up in the morning with your newlywed and looking straight at this magnificent volcano. At night you can even see small streams of lave coming out of it - not from the top - but from the sides and it glows beautifully in the dark. I would really recommend this hotels for honeymoons.
reviews.title: my absolute favorite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know Taormina very well having stayed there a dozen times over the past decade and Bel Soggiorno is always my choice. While it is a short walk uphill to points of interest, the lush gardens, panoramic view, and quiet old world atmosphere are a welcome respite after a busy day near the Corso or at the beach. There is simply nothing like it in Taormina in this price range. All rooms open out to a view of the sea and gardens and many have private patios perfect for a later afternoon glass of win. There is a spacious and comfortable parlor and solarium with wireless. Breakfast is generous with cheeses and salami and can be taken in the morning sunlight or on your porch. Lemon and orange trees grace the slope below. Carlo Capuana and his staff are dedicated to maintaining the horticultural and architectural beauty of this gem and provide a relaxing and most welcoming environment.
